description.narrative:
2018 is the final year of NIMD funding support to the Ghanaian Political Parties Programme (GPPP).
The focus of the programme remains very much on system in this final year. The GPPP continues to offer a political dialogue platform at party leadership level. The dialogue agenda will be oriented towards creating momentum and preparing the ground for a constitutional review. This review should allow GPPP’s policy development work on Ghana’s Winner-Takes-All politics to bear fruit and result in system reform. IEA pursues the lobby it intends to start late 2017, for the constitutional review process to gain momentum, and to convince the Government to follow a route allowing for political dialogue and exchange.
In 2016 and 2017, GPPP brought youth leaders into the policy-making process and offers them opportunity to exchange with political party leadership. These youth leaders will be taken along in GPPP’s 2018 constitutional review efforts.
Beyond this, IEA hopes that progress made and the demands of the constitutional review process help convince donors to support IEA’s dialogue efforts beyond 2018.
The year 2018 will also be used to explore opportunity for peer-support, using the Ghanaian political dialogue model and experience in (and possibly beyond) the region. IEA may seek NIMD’s support in assessing opportunities. It intends to make a start in Anglophone countries (Liberia, Sierra Leone, The Gambia), before moving into Francophone territory.

Political actors are defined as the combined main target group of the Strategic Partnership: - (representatives of) political parties - politicians - (Members of) Parliament and its Committees - Other elected representatives at local levels. NIMD will primarily focus on political parties.
